data.title: Sing Out Loud Returns September 2024!
data.meta_description: Sing Out Loud Festival returns September 21 and 22, 2024 with Eric Church, Noah Kahan, Nora Jones, Marcus King with The Texas Gentlemen and more! Downtown St. Augustine, FL. Tickets at www.singoutloudfestival.com.
data.text:
SING OUT LOUD FESTIVAL RETURNS WITH SUPERSTARS ERIC CHURCH, NOAH KAHAN, RYAN BINGHAM WITH THE TEXAS GENTLEMEN, NORAH JONES AND MORE LIVE AT FRANCIS FIELD SEPTEMBER 21 & 22, 2024

The Live Wildly Showcase, a two-day concert event, features additional performances by Marcus King, The Breeders, Sierra Ferrell, Molly Tuttle & Golden Highway, Kevin Morby, Tré Burt, Nat & Alex Wolff and More in St. Augustine, FL.

Tickets Go On Sale to General Public Friday, March 29 at 10:00 AM

St. Augustine, FL (March 25, 2024) – Sing Out Loud Festival is set to return to Francis Field in downtown St. Augustine on Saturday, September 21, and Sunday, September 22. The Live Wildly Showcase will feature headline performances by country music superstar Eric Church and Americana singer-songwriter Ryan Bingham with The Texas Gentlemen on Saturday, September 21. Folk-pop revivalist Noah Kahan and legendary songstress Norah Jones will take the stage on Sunday, September 22.

Saturday's diverse lineup will also include alternative rock pioneers The Breeders, bluegrass virtuosos Molly Tuttle & Golden Highway, indie folk singer-songwriter Tré Burt, and more. On Sunday, attendees can look forward to performances by retro-soul artist Marcus King, alternative country artist Sierra Ferrell, multi-instrumentalist Kevin Morby, and the energetic brother duo Nat & Alex Wolff.

Tickets for theLive Wildly Showcase go on sale to the geneal public on Friday, March 29 at 10:00AM exclusively online at www.singoutloudfestival.com. Single-day and two-day General Admission, General Admission Plus, and Platinum tickets will be available, along with layaway plans for each respective tier.

As in years past, collaborations with non-profit organizations remain a pillar of Sing Out Loud. This year, Sing Out Loud has partnered with the Live Wildly Foundation, whose mission is to raise public awareness of the importance of preserving Florida’s natural landscapes and wildlife. Their first priority is the Florida Wildlife Corridor, an 18-million-acre wildlife superhighway providing safe passage for some of Florida's most endangered species, including the Florida panther. A portion of ticket sales from the Live Wildly Showcase will be dedicated to conservation efforts within St. Johns County.

"Our team is committed to using the platforms of our programming like Sing Out Loud and the Fort Mose Jazz & Blues Series to make a meaningful community impact," said Gabe Pellicer, CEO & President of SJC Cultural Events. "Our shared values with the Florida State Parks Foundation naturally led us to a partnership with Live Wildly. It's an honor to collaborate with them, merging art with action to champion land conservation and preserve the environment we all treasure."

"We are incredibly excited to partner with the Sing Out Loud festival, which showcases not only Florida's vibrant culture but also our unwavering commitment to preserving its wild beauty,” Lisa Shipley, Live Wildly’s Chief Executive Officer. “At Live Wildly, we believe in creating a balance between our ecology and economy. By harmonizing with nature, this festival provides the perfect platform to inspire environmental protection while celebrating the wild beat that resonates throughout our state. Together, we aim to amplify the need to safeguard Florida's natural resources for future generations."

Sing Out Loud Festival will also feature free local artist showcases, ticketed events, artist development programs, the St. Augustine Record Fair, the St. Augustine Songwriters Festival and more throughout September. Further details will be announced at a later date.
